definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
leisure/relaxation/not working/idle/to enjoy leisure/to lie fallow
to leave sth unused/to lie idle
to stay idle at home/to have resigned from office/to be unemployed/to have been fired/to be on a sabbatical
casual conversation/chat/gossip/to talk about (whatever comes to mind)

sentences.english: These younger generations really are abunch… The world is doomed.
sentences.chinese: 这些年轻人真是闲的蛋疼，这个世界要完了。

sentences.english: Ruthless wild youth in the water, fixed Nanshan day free.
sentences.chinese: 无情野水青春在，不动南山白日闲。

sentences.english: My heart has been idle factors, Kiyokawa Dan so.
sentences.chinese: 我心素已闲，清川澹如此。

sentences.english: His body without shame, know heart every time.
sentences.chinese: 安分身无辱，知几心逢闲。

sentences.english: The leisure touring what is called , it is need to have is rich, wait I satisfy the queen being sure to go to.
sentences.chinese: 所谓旅游嘛，就是要有闲有钱，等我满足后一定会去。

sentences.english: Of all things one enjoys leisure most, but because one does nothing.
sentences.chinese: 人莫乐于闲，非无所事事之谓也。

sentences.english: Thorstein Veblen, The Theory of the Leisure Class, 1899
sentences.chinese: 范伯伦，有闲阶级理论，一八九九年。

sentences.english: On the desk lay idle a pen, ink did not know where to go to.
sentences.chinese: 案台上闲搁着的钢笔，墨水不知去了哪里。

sentences.english: Their eggs Fried rice, Fried bowl in a rush to eat them.
sentences.chinese: 自己炒碗蛋炒饭，匆匆忙闲吃完。

sentences.english: I saw her hacking around the building.
sentences.chinese: 我看见她在那所楼房周围闲遛。

sentences.english: The more we print, the more they have "free" money.
sentences.chinese: 我们印得越多，他们的“闲”钱越多。

sentences.english: But one has got to have the leisure and the money.
I'll be 75 and hanging around bars yacking it up.
sentences.chinese: 我快75岁了，就只剩蹲酒吧嗑闲的份儿了。

sentences.english: Yeah I still play the organ, but not the service, just for myself.
sentences.chinese: 她就是天涯《闲闲书话》里的管风琴斑竹。

sentences.english: My father was busy with his work, so he went to his office as usual.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸工做闲，所以他又同仄居一样去了办公室。

sentences.english: Do you think fish, on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 晚来风定钓丝闲，上下是新月。

definition: to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work/also written 偷閒|偷闲[tou1 xian2]
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work
long or drawn out/remote in time or space/leisurely/to swing/pensive/worried
to bathe/to cleanse/to receive/to be given
